p: In 2005, Liu et al. [ 40] reported that NB4 cells treated with diosgenin resulted in the enlargement of cell size, and arrest was made at G 2/M. Diosgenin increased the p53 levels in NB4 cells, indicating its importance in controlling cell cycle arrest. Flow cytometric sub-G 1 analysis showed that a dramatic hypodiploid number of K562 cells appeared after treatment with diosgenin for 48 h along with DNA fragmentation. Another research carried out by Hsu et al. [ 41] presented that treatment of squamous cell carcinoma-25 (SCC-25) with red mold Dioscorea cell cycle for 24 h caused arrest at the G2/M phase. This effect was also connected to the repression of CDK1 and cyclin B1 mRNA levels, ensuring cell proliferation inhibition.
